title: Part a. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points

1 point: For using Ohm’s law

V = IR

At t = 0 the capacitor contains no charge, so the total voltage drop occurs across the resistor.

V0 = I(0)R and I(0) = (5.20 X 10-3)e-0/10 (where current is in amperes)

1 point: For correctly evaluating the exponential at t = 0

e-0/10 = 1

I(0) = 5.20 X 10-3 A

1 point: For correctly substituting 50 kΩ for the resistance

V0 = (5.20 X 10-3 A)(50 X 103 Ω)

1 point: For the correct answer

V0 = 260 V

title: Part b. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For using the correct expression for capacitance

C = q/V

At t = ∞ the capacitor is fully charged, so the total voltage drop occurs across it. The given expression for the current can be integrated to determine the total charge Q that is stored.

title: Part c. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points (i. 2 points; ii. 2 points)

i. 2 points: For any reasonable answer

For example: There is resistance in the connecting wires. The power supply has an internal resistance. Since we have used a best fit to the actual data, values predicted from that fit have an inherent error.

ii. 2 points

1 point: For indicating that the predicted value of the capacitance is too high or that the actual capacitance is lower

1 point: For any reasonable explanation based on the response to part c. i.

title: Part d. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points (i. 2 points; ii. 2 points)

i. 2 points: For placing an additional resistor in parallel with the original resistor, in a correctly completed circuit.

ii. 2 points: For placing an additional capacitor in series with the original capacitor, in a correctly completed circuit.
